body_html: No, I can't see why would we need to make it this way. torch.from_numpy has no choice other than raising an error, because there is no corresponding type in torch, so it would violate the contract. However, when you use a tensor constructor, you explicitly agree on what the type should be, so casting the array to whatever is needed is a reasonable decision
body_text: No, I can't see why would we need to make it this way. torch.from_numpy has no choice other than raising an error, because there is no corresponding type in torch, so it would violate the contract. However, when you use a tensor constructor, you explicitly agree on what the type should be, so casting the array to whatever is needed is a reasonable decision
body: No, I can't see why would we need to make it this way. `torch.from_numpy` has no choice other than raising an error, because there is no corresponding type in torch, so it would violate the contract. However, when you use a tensor constructor, you explicitly agree on what the type should be, so casting the array to whatever is needed is a reasonable decision
